answerText: Publius Ovidius Naso[10] Many of Ovid's poems consisted of couplets and were written in this melancholy form, which Catullus employed in the poem for his brother which contains the parting line "ave atque vale."
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Northwestern A | 19 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This poet prophecies that "deep rivers will flow backwards," the "earth will bear stars," and "all things will move against the natural laws" after hearing of "A Friend's Treachery." For 10 points each: [10] Name this poet who complained to his friends and family about the pain of his exile in Scythia in Tristia and used hexameter for a poem about the mythological history of the world, the Metamorphoses.
